listOfExercises.exerciseDescription: Start with your knees and hands on the floor. Adjust the distance between your knees and hands so that your body becomes straight. Execute the exercise by lowering and pushing up.
A bodyweight exercise where one pushes their body up starting from a prone position using their arms. Only the toes and hands must be in contact with the ground.

Similar to the normal push up, this is a bodyweight exercise where one pushes their body up. However, the difference here is that you want to raise the feet above the body using a block or bench. This exercise requires more strength as more weight is put on the hands.
Load the bench press with medium weights to tire out the muscle. Make sure to control the weight on the on the way down, and up.

Load the bench press with a heavy load for maximum muscle activation. The goal is to move the weight from point A to point B, so you need to coordinate well but don't stretch out the movement longer than needed.
No equipment needed, bring hips at or below knee level.
Load the bar with the weight you.
Load up the calves heavy and use ankle extension for maximum results. Low rest time so that you feel the burn.

listOfRoutines.routineDescription: Starts from easy exercises and gets progressively more difficult.
